sen.j: 大蔵卿藤原通基 (大蔵卿)の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of Okura-kyo (Minister of the Treasury) FUJIWARA no Michimoto (Okura-kyo).

sen.j: 母は大蔵卿源師隆の娘で待賢門院の女房である上西門院一条（上西門院乳母）。
sen.e: His mother was Joseimoninichijo (Joseimonin no menoto (a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby)) who was Taikenmonin's nyogo (a court lady) and she was a daughter of Okura-kyo (Minister of the Treasury) MINAMOTO no Morotaka.

sen.j: 中御門流一条家の祖であり、一条通重とも表記する。
sen.e: He was the founder of the Ichijo family of Nakamikado-ryu (Nakamikado lines), and his name can be written as '一条通重' (Ichijo Michishige).

sen.j: 兄の早世により通基の嫡男と位置付けられるが、自らもまた保元年間の頃に早世した。
sen.e: Due to his brother's premature death, he was positioned as the heir of Michimoto but he died early as well in the Hogen era.

sen.j: 一条の家名の由来となったのは彼の母である上西門院一条が有していた一条室町の邸宅である。
sen.e: The family name Ichijo came from the residence that his mother Joseimoninichijo owned in Ichijo-Muromachi.

sen.j: 後年、能保は朝廷と草創期の鎌倉幕府との間に立って重きをなし、従二位・権中納言まで立身している。
sen.e: Later in life, Yoshiyasu performed a crucial function between the court and the early period of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and he was promoted to Junii Gon Chunagon (Junior Second Rank provisional vice-councilor of state).
